Math Anxiety

What you need to get through this course and be a savvy user of statistics in life.

There are many anxieties in a first stats course, and math anxiety is a common one.

I believe that you can be a sophisticated user of most statistics with the math you were required to learn in grade-school. The most important subjects are:

  • ratios and proportions
  • how to interpret a formula (especially the equation for a line: y = mx + b)
  • exponents and logarithms

That’s really all there is to most introductory statistics. I am supremely confident that anybody can learn these. Even if you were told you couldn’t. But I completely understand that some people’s exposure to math has been a truly terrible and horrifying experience. If you aren’t comfortable with the three things above, come see me. I’d love to show you that it is possible to understand these.

I highly recommend the following book for people that want a refresher in these subjects:

What you need to know to pursue data science further
